headline: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake V
description: This recipe makes a two-layer pineapple upside-down cake using cake mix and canned pineapple.

video.description: See how to make a 5-star pineapple upside down cake.
video.name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake V

name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake V
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) can sliced pineapple, drained with juice reserved
1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple, drained with juice reserved

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat the bottoms and sides of each 9 inch round cake pan with 2 tablespoons of melted butter. Sprinkle the bottom of each pan with 1/4 cup of brown sugar.

In one of the pans, sprinkle coconut over the brown sugar. Lay pineapple rings in a single layer on top of coconut. Place a cherry in the center of each ring. In the other pan, spread the drained crushed pineapple.
Mix the cake as directed on package, but substitute reserved pineapple juice in place of water. Divide batter between the 2 pans. Remember which pan has the pineapple rings in it.
Bake for 40 to 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean. Cool in pans for 20 minutes.

While the bottoms of the cake pans are still warm to the touch, invert the layer with the crushed pineapple out onto a serving dish, then gently invert the layer with the pineapple rings on top of it for a dazzling two layer pineapple upside down cake.

review.reviewBody: Caution: An 8oz. can of sliced pineapple is only FOUR SLICES! If you want more than four slices to work with, use a larger can. I made this using two 9 inch round cake pans, and still had more than enough room for more pineapple slices/could have cut some in half to really have good coverage. As is, four slices cut in half would have only made a nice border. I literally LOL'd at the person who said the cake was dry, and that using the pineapple juice from the can left you almost a cup short on liquid! You do know that you drain BOTH cans of pineapple, right? The 8oz. can only gives like ¼ cup of juice. You have to drain the crushed pineapple too! A sieve works great, and you might have to do some pressing, but I assure you, you'll get the amount of liquid the cake mix box says you need (1 cup). You could have also topped it up with water to make the required amount of liquid, or just used straight pineapple juice from the store. Great recipe, a huge hit! Have made several times!

I made this with just one change. I’m not big on maraschino cherries, so I bought some sour cherry spread. I couldn’t spread it over the brown sugar so I put it in the micro and melted it, then poured it over the brown sugar and put the pineapple rings on top of that.
Oh yes. I lined the bottoms and sides of two springform pans with parchment paper and brushed the paper with the melted butter.
I added lemon zest and a few squeezes of lemon juice into the cake batter. This is my very first pineapple upside down cake, and I love it!
USE 2 CAKE BOXS!
this is one of the best recipe of pineapple upside- down cake i have ever had , loved it it lasted 2days at my house
I didn't change any ingredients in the recipe, but used pineapple chunks on top layer instead of the rings. It was very good, I will be making this again.
I made this cake for Fathers Day so it hasn’t been eaten yet! It sure looks pretty. I’m sure I’ll impress a few with this one.

I do not use the cake mix from a box and just make a yellow cake batter with some pineapple juice. The topping for this recipe is wonderful. I double it and make a rectangle cake instead of 2 rounds. My cook time was 35-40min. Thanks for the recipe!
Yes I changed the receipt a little by not adding coconuts. I used the pineapple upside down cake mix instead of the yellow cake mix.
Amazing!

So awesome! Sooo easy!! I used the Duncan Hines butter mix, as recommended, and OMG Yum!!! I forgot the coconut, and was a bit sad about that, but it was so good without it, I did not miss it for a second. I will for sure make this again
First time making a pineapple upside down cake and it came out really good! Might use less coconut next time or put it on the bottom layer To give it a better look on top!
Love this recipe!! I did as another suggested & put it in 9X13 an put crushed pineapple in between the pouring of the batter. Came out fantastic!!!
I did everything except the coconut flakes and I put strained pineapple chunks into the batter. Cake out amazing!

I followed the recipe (except for cooking time thank goodness) and it needs some work. The top wasn’t pretty. All of the brown sugar and butter covered the pineapple and cherries. Next time, I think I will put the pineapple and cherries down first, then the coconut (probably a bit less of it), and then the brown sugar and melted butter. I didn’t have enough juice, or as many pineapple rings as I wanted for decorating (an 8oz can is only four rings?!), so next time I’ll get a bigger can of rings and that should give enough juice. I cooked it for 30 minutes at 350 which was still too much. I like the idea of a layered pineapple upside down cake, but I’m not happy with this one just yet. Thinking I might also add an extra 8oz can of crushed pineapple into the cake batter.
Also only let it cool for 10-15 minutes.

This was the easiest Pineapple Upside-Down Cake I have ever made. I worked in bakeries for years, and am super picky when it comes to baked goods. Normally, I hate anything made with a box mix, but had to whip up something fast. Made just as directed, no changes. Turned out great. Moist, delicious, easy. Thought there was no way it was going to come out of pan, but did! Ok...one change....used regular size 20 oz can of sliced pineapples. Used rings for top of one cake, and just diced up others to cover other side in place of crushed pineapple. Worked great. My hubby likes sweet stuff, and thought may need icing....but plenty sweet without.

Very easy recipe. I used a Duncan Hines pineapple cake mix.
As suggested from others, I increased the butter to 1/2 cup. 
The bake time was also way off for my electric oven. Over an hour! Used a thin wooden kabob stick and tested every 5 minutes after the 60 minutes. I cooled the 11/13 glass pan till the bottom was warm to the touch, and it popped over with no problem.

All 7 of us loved it! I didn't want to fiddle with the 2-layer thing - we just wanted something sweet and yummy for a quick dessert. This fit the bill. I made mine in a 9x13 and just used a can of chunk pineapple since that's what I happened to have (not 2 cans as in recipe). I added my melted butter, brown sugar, coconut, then threw in my pineapple chunks and cherries and tried to spread them out evenly. Topped with the yellow cake mix made with pineapple juice, and baked as per recipe instructions. It came out delish! I'm definitely be making it again.
I did as others suggested and used a 9 by 13. So moist, so good! Rave reviews from guests and nothing was left! An absolute keeper and go to for me.

Made without coconut as I wasn't in the mood.

Used 2 rings pineapple and some juice from the can. Added to pint of fresh whipped cream with 1/3 sugar and used between the layers. 

Had my boyfriend bring some to work. His boss said he will marry me if he does'nt.

Made without coconut as I wasn't in the mood.

Used 2 rings pineapple and some juice from the can. Added to pint of fresh whipped cream with 1/3 sugar and used between the layers. 

Had my boyfriend bring some to work. His boss said he will marry me if he does'nt.
Perfect for Easter desert!

Very easy and tasty. I had some fresh pineapple to use up so I cut it into chunks, skipped the cherries and made two separate 8 in. square pans cakes. One to give away, one to keep. Baked approx. 25-30 mins. I have tried yellow cake mix, pineapple and French vanilla. All of them have come out great. I liked it served warm with whipped cream..yumm!

I also turned this into a 9x13 cake. I used Betty Crocker Golden butter recipe, his brand has pudding in the mix and called for butter not oil. Been years since I’d made this type of cake and it appealed to me as my husband loves coconut. I’m not a fan of it so I just put it on half. I used a 1/2 cup of melted butter on the bottom as suggested and it was perfect. As for the 8 oz of pineapple I mixed it into the cake batter and poured it over the pineapples and cherries. It turned out incredibly fluffy and moist. What a hit! I’ll be sure to make it again. Snuck a bite and almost ate 1/4 of the cake. I’m also 9 months pregnant. Make it, you won’t be disappointed.
I made in a 9x13 pan so didn’t use the extra crushed pineapple. Turned out perfect
I loved it, will make it again. I may more crushed pineapple next time for even more goodness.
Loved this recipe! I may add more coconut next time.
i forgot to sub. the pineapple juice for the water in the cake mix,but nobody complained, it was very moist and easy to make. i would mak it again,
i forgot to sub. the pineapple juice for the water in the cake mix,but nobody complained, it was very moist and easy to make. i would mak it again,
I have been making this for over 30 yrs.The cooking time on this is way longer than I cook it. I cook mine about 30 minutes (but it depends on the oven) Never none leftover
The picture shows a 9x13 pan, so that's what I did. Didn't use crushed pineapple at all.

Very delicious. I definitely recommend getting a GOOD cake mix. If you can't find a good cake mix then just make it from scratch. I used the Betty Crocker Super Moist Yellow Cake Mix and it was not good. I thought that the pineapple would soak through the cake and overwhelm its store bought, fake vanilla taste but no. It still persisted. It was still amazing though. 

Changes for next time: make a pineapple jam to put in between the two layers, squeeze more juice out of the pineapple before putting down in pan, more butter and brown sugar on the edges (the crispy sugar on the edges were phenomenal).

Also, despite what some reviewers said, I found the cake even more delicious the next day! The refrigeration really made the pineapple really delicious and gave the cake time to soak in the flavors without going mushy. 10/10
Made for a BIRTHDAY Cake. It was delicious.
I didn’t care for the two layers as much as the regular recipe, regular is especially good cooked in an iron skillet.
Didn’t want to waste egg yolks so added them to cake mix. No change in taste. Recipe was quick and easy to make. Tasted great.

As noted before, butter cake is a must! I did a 13x9 and did a center layer of crushed pineapple but cut the qty in half to 1/2C to reduce the overall moisture. The coconut is the bomb. Totally different cake!, thanks so much.
I made the two level and everyone at work said it was wonderful.

The ingredients are great, but the baking time listed is WAY too long. It says 40-50 minutes for two small round pans. I did 45 minutes and my cakes were extremely overcooked, dried out, and the pineapple all stuck. Would be willing to try it again for 30 minutes, but I'm super bummed right now (it was my mom's birthday cake).
I did the Betty Crocker recipe and added 1/4 cup extra pineapple juice. I don’t like coconut so I didn’t use it but otherwise my first time making it and it turned out great !!

My granddaughter wanted dark chocolate pineapple upside down cake! We used dark chocolate cake mix. Adding the pineapple juice to dark chocolate mix made it awesome! Think she started a new tradition! Try it.
Excellent and not difficult
I only did one layer, but did not change anything else and it was a hit! Will definitely make again.

Followed recipe using DH Golden Butter cake mix. I put both pans in the oven at the same time but the bottom layer cooked faster and was done in 25 min. Top layer took another 5 minutes. Definitely check your cakes early. 
Cooled 20 min and they came out of the pans easily, but the top did break a bit when trying to get on top of the bottom layer. Still tasty though!

Delicious! I was excited and nervous to make an upside cake, but this recipe made it easy! I added parchment paper cut to fit the pan. The only thing I didn't like was the coconut on top. It covered the pineapple rings so that you couldn't see them. You actually couldn't tell it was a pineapple upside down cake, so I will definitely leave that off in the future.
forgot by accident the coconut but still very good
Made no changes, and the family enjoyed this cake. I have had a moister upside-down cake, but really enjoyed the double layer and the addition of coconut!
I have made this a couple of times and we love it. I've evolved to using a Duncan Hines Pineapple Cake Mix, 9 x 13 pan because it's most convenient for me.
So easy, so delicious! My husband loved it :) thanks for sharing this recipe!
It looks so good when it comes out of the oven.

This cake turned out great. I use the Bundt cake pan to make it. I cut the pineapples in half and layered it in the bottom of the Bundt cake with half a pineapple and a cherry in between around the entire Pan. I doubled the butter and sugar for the bottom of the pan. And I omitted the coconut just because I don’t have any available in my pantry.I did as other uses suggested and poured half of the cake mix then a layer of the crushed pineapples and then the other half of the cake mix.And I did add a Full of Rum to the cake mix batter for good luck. I only let it cool 10 minutes before I inverted it. This cake was delicious warm.
I left the coconut out just because my family doesn't care for it. It was an awesome cake and I will make it many more times
Beautiful dessert and delicious. After putting the top layer on put the pan over the cake for 20 or 30 minutes to avoid cracking.

This is my dad's favorite cake that I make him every year. I pretty much follow the recipe to a T except I make it in a 9x13 Pyrex and add WAY more brown sugar and coconut than called for. I also use Pillsbury Golden Butter Moist Supreme Cake Mix which makes this cake melt in your mouth.

Never had a two layer cake like this one! I will be making it again! Moist and so flavorful, I was dubious of the coconut, but it all paired beautifully. Definitely a try me cake. Be sure to keep refrigerated if it lasts more than a couple of days!
This was easy to make. I made it in a 9 x 13 glass baking dish. It took about 40 minutes in the oven and flipped it out after about 20 minutes. My family loved it and I'll surely make it again!
I used no coconut, less brown sugar, substituted crushed pineapple and baked as one layer in a cast iron skillet. It was great! Will definitely make this recipe again.
Hubby finally had a request and is not to fond of coconut so I made desperate cakes and he ends up liking it with coconut. Easy recipe and very tasty!!

I love this recipe. It's always a big hit. I do mine a little differently. I use a bundt cake pan. I spread the butter all over the pan, sprinkle the brown sugar, coconut, then add the coconut rings, I cut the remaining rings and put halves around the sides. Then Cherries in the middle of the pineapples. Then mixing the cake mix I use the Pineapple juice for the water and add a can of crushed Pineapple right in the mix. Add to the pan and bake for about 40 minutes. Cool. Transfer to a plate.
I usually do my cakes from scratch & gluten free, but was in a hurry, so I used a GF package, it was still very tasty & super moist, everyone loved it! I will make again!!
This cake was super yummy, will be making this again.
Just make sure to drain the crushed pineapple real good!!
Amazing!

This is so good! I had never made a pineapple upside down cake before and I'm so glad this was the recipe I used. I did forget the coconut but not a big fan of it anyway. I used a Pillsbury Golden Butter cake, took out at 25 mins, let cool 15 mins, then put pan back on top layer so it would not crack as was suggested by other reviewers. My son couldn't wait for it to cool. I asked him if I should make this again and he said most definitely.
Made this recipe. No problem with cracking. It was ready in 40 minutes. Didn't look pretty as the pineapple baked into the top so I decorated with cherries and whip cream.

Loved it ! add a little coolwhip on top and it is awesome !
I have made it several times in the last few months, Everyone loves this version.
It turned out great. It was moist and the taste was great
Excellent dessert. I used 20 oz of crushed pineapple by mistake and it was just fine. I also added coconut extract instead of the shredded coconut because people think they don't like coconut!

I just made this but I made a few adjustments. I used the pineapple flavored cake mix from Duncan Hines, added ¼ cup of crushed pineapple in the batter, and lightly toasted my coconut. I also drizzled some caramel sauce over it 

 Is can't wait til it cools down so I can taste it

I made this for a family get together, the kids and family loved it. Me not so much as I would have like for the cake to be moist. The taste of the cake was good, but not as moist as I would like for it to be. Next time I will look for a home made recipe, not one from the box. Followed recipe as written, added a little extra juice. Probably will not make again.

I made this recipe but made some changes. instead of yellow cake mix i made Betty Crocker Lemon cake mix and added lemon zest and juice of the lemon to the cake mix, didnot use the pineapple juice as in the recipe. Also I baked the bottom layer in a deep dish pie plate so that the bottom layer was a bit wider than the top. i omitted the coconut and just added some chopped walnuts to the bottom layer. everybody lovedd it! it was my husbands choice for his birthday cake!!

I made this recipe for my daughter's birthday using all organic ingredients. No cherries. Looks and smells great. Party isn't until tomorrow. Therefore, haven't tasted it yet. Tip for cake cracking.: I learned this at a decorating class. Wrap the sides of the pan with damp cotton cloth. Wilton makes wraps for cake pans, but I made my own. I cut old cotton towel double the hight of the pan. Folded it in half, dampened it, wrapped it around pan, and secured wth safety pin. Your cake will cook evenly. No hump in the middle and no dark sides..

Good basic recipe but it became delicious when I made a few changes. I used a 9x13 pan. Put in butter, brown sugar, coconut then a drained 20oz can of sliced pineapple in single layer. Topped that with a yellow butter cake mix using the 1 c of the drained juice. I did not add any crushed pineapple nor cherries because I found they made the cake way too sweet. Baked at 350 for 35 min. Remove from pan after 15 min to prevent sticking. It was fantastic and everyone loved it. I would give it more stars, but I had to make too many changes.
Great cake. I only used the pineapple slices not the crushed ones in a 13X9.
My father in law taught me to bake this amost 39 yrs ago. It is an oldie but goodie!!!!
This was moist several days after. Followed the recipe to a T, don't change anything. Easy and good.

I prepared the cake as written except for having used Duncan Hines Butter Cake mix. It was very dry. And as many have noted, in order to cover the top layer with pineapple you need to have a 16 oz can of pineapple slices. An 8 oz. can only yields 4 slices. I won't make this again without a lot of tweaking.

Awesome recipe. Always made this in 9 x 13 pan. Only thing different was the cherries. When I got the cherries out of the fridge I found my husband had eaten all the cherries. So I spooned cherry juice into the middle of the pineapple ring The juice managed to spread a little which gave it a mixed glow. Only cooked for 32 min. No problem stacking the layers. Only let it cool for 10 min. Came out beautiful for someone that never gets it perfect.
Loved it!!!! Followed the recipe and just added guava sauce on the second layer and top. Very good!!!
Very easy to make and it was delicious! I only had pineapple chunks, but they were no problem and I added more cherries than if you just put them inside the pineapple rings.
Perfect recipe....comes out great everytime!
Fabulous recipe!

The cake came out wonderfully! It was very moist! My husband is not a cook at all, he barely knows were anything goes in the kitchen and he would be able to make this cake! The top didn't harden like otter reviewers did. I omitted the coconut because I don't care much for coconut and I used a bundt pan instead of making it a layer cake. Other than that I followed directions verbatim. I would like to find a homemade version of this recipe and try that! Half of the cake was gone the first night I made it and only 5 people got some and one doesn't even care for pineapple, so, needless to say I will be making this again, and again and again!

Pineapple!!!Who would have ever thought this fruit could be come a head turner!!! I LOVE LOVE this pineapple upside down cake! To make it yummier I used 1 (8oz) cream cheese, using with about 1/4 cup of some of the left over flaked coconut and 1 tsp of vanilla extract, using a hand mixer to incorporate it together for 2 minutes. I reserved enough of it to use on the sides of the cake and stuck more coconut on the sides and I used the rest between the top and bottom layer which was very tasty and kept them to stick together. Look for the pictures I submitted so you can see what I actually mean. I didn't want any of the taste of the cherry since cherry isn't the best tasting fruit especially after being in the preservatives in the liquid it comes in, I just used it as a garnish, putting one in the ring of each pineapple after it was baked. I also sprayed butter flavored spray oil ONLY in the bottom cake pan then used wax paper (or you can use parchment paper)on top of that and sprayed the top of the wax paper with a little more of the spray so that the bottom cake would not stick or be dry. It is the moistest yummiest cake ever!! This cake is absolutely fail proof and people will think you got it from a bakery; it's that good!!!

I've been using this recipe for a long time! Can substitute with just about any boxed cake mix on hand, but I like it best with a butter recipe yellow (Duncan Hines, I think). Thanks for a solid go-to, easy dessert!
This was so easy to make and it tasted amazing!
Huge success. I used pineapple cake mix. Everything else was the same. Everyone was happy. I also followed cooking time on the cake mix box. The suggested time is to long.
Delicouse!!! We will defiantly keep maken this cake!!! All I can say is so Awsome!!! Thanks so much for recipe!!!
This was so easy and delicious. My husband loved it. I covered the sides with frosting mixed with coconut.

This was a smash hit for Easter dessert yesterday! My family and friends totally raved about it. So much so, in fact,that everyone tried stealing the remainder of the cake when they left! I made a few changes; a packaged pineapple cake mix for instance,and 4 eggs; following the package directions. It's AWESOME!!! Will be keeping this one for sure.
It came out very good except the pineapple slices did not show on the top of the cake. I added another layer of slices to the top to make the presentation a little better.

I made this for my mother in law birthday and she liked it. I did make it in 9x13 so I should have increased the amount of pineapple slices but beside that it was super moist and she was happy so I am happy

Made as stated except I used a yellow butter cake mix and added more pineapple rings to cover the whole bottom of the pan. This was good but not outstanding. Maybe extra butter and brown sugar as others have stated would take this to the next level.

I liked this and it was pretty easy to do. I used a whole stick of butter, ½ a stick in each pan. I added coconut to the bottom layer too. I also put some pecan halves on the top layer before I laid down the coconut layer. I was going to use a regular yellow cake mix, but I saw a pineapple flavored cake mix, so I used that instead. In my oven they were done in 35 minutes not the 40-50. I did not let it sit 20 minutes before turning out. I turned them immediately. Next time I will make sure I spread the batter a little better as my cake was a bit lopsided. That is OK though it still tasted good :)

I liked this and it was pretty easy to do. I used a whole stick of butter, ½ a stick in each pan. I added coconut to the bottom layer too. I also put some pecan halves on the top layer before I laid down the coconut layer. I was going to use a regular yellow cake mix, but I saw a pineapple flavored cake mix, so I used that instead. In my oven they were done in 35 minutes not the 40-50. I did not let it sit 20 minutes before turning out. I turned them immediately. Next time I will make sure I spread the batter a little better as my cake was a bit lopsided. That is OK though it still tasted good :)

Oh YUM. My daughter and I made our first pineapple upside cake with this recipe and it was gone in minutes. The cake was a little soggy under the pineapple, but pretty sure it was user error--didn't drain pineapple enough. Thanks for the tasty recipe!

Don't like yellow cake mix so I use a pineapple cake mix (if I'm in a hurry and can't make from scratch). Really good! As another reviewer says, turn pan over right away after baking so that the topping drips onto the cake and doesn't stick in the bottom of the pan.

My cake was really moist and delicious. I made a couple of changes recommended by other reviewers. I replaced the yellow cake mix with Pillsbury's Moist Supreme Golden Butter Recipe mix. I accidentally made the cake with water instead of the reserved pineapple juice, but it was still very flavorful. Lastly, I added 1/2 tsp imitation coconut flavoring to the cake mix. I was very happy with the results and will make this cake again!

I can't believe I forgot the butter and this still turned out great! I baked mine in a bundt pan and it turned out moist and delicious, although I will try it in the 2 rounds next time. I will definitely make this again!
